radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple surgical clips in the area of the previous right adrenalectomy. A small nodule anterior to the left kidney. Left adrenal gland was diffusely thickened, suggesting the possibility of a small left adrenal mass. An oblong density left of the aorta, consistent with a left para-aortic node or left renal artery.
Somewhat thickened left adrenal gland without evidence of a discrete mass. No hepatic, splenic, or pancreatic lesions.
Focus of activity in the upper abdomen, immediately to the left and anterior to the left lobe of the liver.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Focus disappeared 48 hours after [131I]MIBG scanning, suggesting uptake and excretion in the colon.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Area of 6-[18F]fluorodopamine-derived radioactivity in the region of the previous right adrenalectomy, suggesting recurrent pheochromocytoma.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Close comparison with MRI indicated that the area extended about 3â€“4 cm anteriorly and medially from the right adrenal surgical bed to the region of the inferior vena cava.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Increased [123I]MIBG uptake in the right adrenal bed.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Confirmed previous findings from the vena caval sampling and 6-[18F]fluorodopamine PET scanning.
